{"step_by_step_thinking": "Von Willebrand factor (vWF) is a glycoprotein that plays a crucial role in blood clotting. It is primarily secreted by endothelial cells and platelets. Macrophages are not known to secrete vWF, and fibroblasts are not involved in the production of vWF. Therefore, the correct answer is B. Endothelial cells.", "answer_choice": "B"}
